news.title: 400,000 People Have Registered to Vote Through Snapchat
news.description: The social media platform has unveiled a number of voting tools, including its in-app voter registration option, and additional promotions will feature celebrities and popular politicians.

news.title: Facebook Is Paying People to Shut Down Their Accounts Ahead of the Election
news.description: In an effort to better understand its role in elections, Facebook is reportedly offering payment to users to deactivate their Facebook and Instagram profiles for between one and six weeks.

news.title: YouTube Starts Rolling Out Its TikTok Competitor, YouTube Shorts
news.description: YouTube’s new short-form video creator will roll out initially in India, and in a format that is similar to TikTok, will allow users to make 15-second videos set to background music.

news.title: Facebook Tried to Limit QAnon. It Failed.
news.description: The social media giant’s efforts to counteract the conspiracy theory and other extremist content on its platform have been unsuccessful in stopping the proliferation of QAnon groups.
